        NoKeyFieldException - if no key field found.

      • invokeLocalMethod

        protected void invokeLocalMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                 java.lang.Object[] args)
                          throws java.lang.Throwable
        This mechanism helps to create 'pointcuts' inside the MObjects. Therefore, a data manager can use local methods for pointcut definitions.
        Parameters:
        method - the default method
        args - any arguments of the default method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case of invocation error.

      • invokeDefaultMethod

        protected java.lang.Object invokeDefaultMethod(java.lang.Object proxy,
                                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                               java.lang.Object[] args)
                                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        The default method are forwarded to the InvocationHandler. But we want to call the default implementation in case of existence. Check if the object has defined any default methods in its schema The default method has already been overridden by the proxy and it can't be invoked directly. In this case we invoke the default method with the given args.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy instance
        method - the method that has been called
        args - any arguments of the method
        Returns:
        any return values of the method, null if none
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case of error during invocation

      • _callDefaultMethod

        protected java.lang.Object _callDefaultMethod(java.lang.Object proxy,
                                              java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                              java.lang.Object[] args)
                                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Default method invocation in managed object.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy instance
        method - the method that has been called
        args - any arguments of the method
        Returns:
        any return values of the method, null if none
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case of error during invocation
